title: Trump said Harvard has seen violent crime skyrocket. Data from campus police says otherwise.
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News The Harvard Crimson editorial board slammed the Trump administration's claim that crime has risen on campus, citing university police data showing that most crimes on campus have declined.
A banner on the Harry Elkins Widener Memorial Library at the Harvard University campus in Cambridge, Massachusetts.

Bloomberg The editorial board of Harvard’s student newspaper blasted the Trump administration’s claim that crime at the university has “drastically risen,” pointing to campus police data showing that crime reports have dropped over the past year.

title: Everett 7th grader arrested by ICE had a knife on him, mayor says, but no gun
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News Everett’s mayor contradicted a federal official’s earlier claim that the boy was armed with both a knife and a gun when apprehended.
Yuki Iwamura/AP Photo By Abby Patkin updated on October 14, 2025 | 5:03 PM 3 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

A 13-year-old Everett boy arrested by federal immigration officials last week had a knife on him when apprehended, but no gun, Mayor Carlo DeMaria said Tuesday, contradicting an earlier claim from a Department of Homeland Security official.
